page.title: 03ILFRACOMBE HARBOUR
page.content: Today in the harbour there are only small privately owned fishing and sailing boats.Some fishing boats take parties of people fishing.One boat,the Queen of Cornwall,takes visitors for voyages along the coast in summer.Surrounding the harbour are many small shops.One is a boat chandlers and the others are mainly gift shops used by tourists rather than local people.You will also find cafes,restaurants and take away food shops,but they are only open in the summer season.There is a pier where the life boat is stationed.Both adults and children enjoy fishing from the pier.It is very crowded in the summer the car parks are always full and even the pier is used for parking cars.Once a year a paddle steamer,the Waverley, arrives and takes passengers to Lundy.
